medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 7 days before admission with malaise, frontal headaches, light-headedness, fatigue, palpitations, and shortness of breath. Nausea and vomiting led to early school dismissal. Two days prior to admission, the primary care physician found normal examination results. On the night of admission, sudden right-sided weakness and numbness developed, accompanied by abdominal pain and increased confusion and agitation over the course of the evening.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of lupus nephritis, diagnosed 3 years earlier which included hypertension and proteinuria.
medical_history.family_history: Biologic mother's family had diabetes mellitus and hypertension.
medical_history.social_history: Patient did not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs; lived with adoptive parents and sibling.
